children.name: open
Attach open event handler via bind(); detach via unbind()
Attach open event handler during initialization

children.description: Triggered before the responsive panel is opened. Cancellable.

children.name: close
Attach close event handler via bind(); detach via unbind()
Attach close event handler during initialization

children.description: Triggered before the responsive panel is closed. Cancellable.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the widget for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls the `destroy` method of any child Kendo widgets.> This method does not remove the widget element from DOM.

children.name: toggleButton
children.description: Specifies the selector for the toggle button that will show and hide the responsive panel.

children.name: orientation
children.description: Specifies the direction from which the hidden element will open up, once the toggle button has been activated. Valid values are "left", "right", and "top".

children.name: breakpoint
children.description: Specifies the page width at which the widget will be hidden and its toggle button will become visible.

children.name: autoClose
children.description: If set to `false` the widget will not close when the page content is touched, after it was opened on a mobile device. You will need to call the [close method](#methods-close) when the panel needs to close.
